comment.body:
Unless there's an API that I missed, no. When downloading a file from ZeroNet your browser isn't actually downloading it, ZeroNet is. Once ZeroNet has downloaded it the browser can access the local copy. 

Only exception to this that I know of is ZeroMux which chunks up large files into pieces before adding them for sharing on ZeroNet. When a user then downloads the file it's actually asking for a bunch of small files, so for example when 5 out of 100 pieces are downloaded, 5% is known to be complete. Once the user has all the pieces, javascript in their browser then combines them on-the-fly into one coherent file they can save or view. Though the latest ZeroNet update seems to have broken ZeroMux and it hasn't been updated yet.
